body: The rule is supposed to only check `import` statements, so I'm not sure why would it report an export.

~This is because the `export ... from 'module'` is [not yet](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-export-ns-from) [part of JavaScript](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-export-default-from), and ESLint doesnâ€™t support features that are still proposals. This would be a good rule suggestion for [`eslint-plugin-babel`](https://github.com/babel/eslint-plugin-babel), though.~ This is incorrect; see below.

~@asapach Iâ€™m trying to say that everything but the first line in your initial code sample is **not** part of ES2015, ES2016, or ES2017. Itâ€™s currently a [stage 1 proposal](https://github.com/tc39/proposals#stage-1) (`export v from "mod";` statements). Therefore, itâ€™s out-of-scope for ESLint.~

~ES2015 only supports this:~
<s>
```js
import foo from 'bar'
import { foo, bar as baz } from 'quux'

export const /* or let/var */ foo = 2
export {
  foo as bar,
  baz
}
export default foo
```
</s>

~However, I would be interested in seeing this checked by `eslint-plugin-babel`.~

This is incorrect; see below.
@j-f1 [the proposal](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-export-default-from) is specifically about a more convenient syntax for re-exporting `default` and has nothing to do with this issue.

ðŸ¤¦â€â™‚ï¸ sorry. Thanks for sharing that with me! I mustâ€™ve misread the proposals I linked to. Iâ€™ll take a look at this and see if I can fix it.

Notes to self: [rule source](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/master/lib/rules/no-restricted-imports.js), copy-paste[?] `ImportDeclaration` to `"ExportAllDeclaration, ExportNamedDeclaration"`. ExportAll -> `isRestrictedForEverythingImported`, ExportNamed -> `isRestrictedPath`
@j-f1 There's no rush, but have you gotten a chance to take a look at this?
I have not gotten a chance to look at this yet.

issue.title: Update: Restrict re-exports in no-restricted-imports
